docs.lead_paragraph: SHARON PFLUGER held her 2-month-old daughter, Kileigh, up near her shoulder, bouncing her slightly. Both were smiling down on the girls far below their perch in the press box at Lions Stadium. The College of New Jersey women's lacrosse team had just beaten the visitors from Frostburg State University, 18-4. While Kileigh is a newcomer to such victories, it has become rather commonplace for her mother. The Frostburg game was Ms. Pfluger's 222nd victory in her 15 years as head coach at the College of New Jersey.
docs.abstract: Article on Sharon Pfluger, who coaches winning women's lacrosse and field hockey teams at College of New Jersey as well as teaches coaching; photos (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Q: Isn't the seventh month a time to slow down? It would be nice to have a full night's sleep again, but I have a feeling that's years away. Maybe when they're all in school. It's probably in a distant enough future that I shouldn't start fantasizing about it now. Twins pregnancy is difficult. And it's been challenging to have this transition of power in the governor's office happen now, as I am deep into my third trimester. But we're being reasonable, and it just forces me to be more organized, more selective about how I utilize my time. You're talking to me from the car now -- how long is the commute from the Berkshires?

headline.main: The Way We Live Now: 4-29-01: Questions for Jane Swift; Expecting Big Things

docs.abstract: Interview with Massachusetts Gov Jane Swift, mother of toddler who is pregnant with twins, on commute between motherhood and statehouse; photo (M)ï
